Entries.default: As you return to the world, you feel a hand on your back.

"That was amazing! Where'd you go? What'd you see?! 

"Don't try and hold back on me, 'cause I felt something happening."

"You all right? C'mon, we just got you back."

Despite his tone, you can see genuine concern in Edér's eyes.

"The last time I saw you like that, you'd just suffered an Awakening. 

"Is everything all right?" His eyes search your face.
"I'm fine."
"Not even a little."
"I'm not sure."
"Heard you say that before. Had something to do with a two-thousand-year-old lunatic talking to you in your dreams."
He forces a polite smile but continues to watch you with apparent concern.
"If you say so."
"Well, if you're not sure, now I'm worried."
His brow furrows with worry.

"It's better to get it out of your system. I'll wait."

She crosses her arms over her chest, watching you with concern. After a moment passes without any retching, she relaxes her stance.
"What went on in there, anyway? You touched the adra and just... froze. Then you let go and the whole thing lit back up."

"I've seen you commune with souls of the dead, but this looked altogether different. 

"What happened?" His gaze flickers to the brightly glowing adra.
"All right. So what happened?"
"I saw Eothas. And he saw me."
"Eothas tethered himself to the luminous adra, and I connected to him through the essence."
"You're asking me?!"
"Already? Moving things along rather quickly this time, aren't we?" His eyebrows rise with sly mischief.

"You - well, he - really?! I knew it! I mean, that's great, Watcher. Ain't it?"

Xoti can barely contain herself, jumping up and down as she stumbles over her words.
"Not sure if that's good or bad, but he didn't kill you, so I guess we can call it good."
"I don't suppose you could deduce where he's going next."
"What'd Gaun say? Is he going to meet us? What do we do next? He charged you with a divine calling, didn't he? Just like he's done for me."
"Don't suppose he told you what he's up to, did he? Or at least where he's going?"
"He was headed toward another pillar of luminous adra."
"All I know, is we got to help my god. If he's looking for luminous adra pillars, I say we head him off at the next one."
"Well, you're the one who's been floating around talking to gods, but it seems like if Eothas is using this luminous adra, we need to look for more of it."
"Perhaps we could search other sources of luminous adra. He certainly seems to have had business with this one."

"I wonder what he's after, and why he's been giving me these dreams. 

"The things I've seen - they leave a mark on your soul." She rubs her arms despite the balmy air.
"How hard can it be to find... in a chain of thousands of islands?"
"At least he'll be easier to spot than Thaos." He turns away from the pillar, giving you a half-smile.
[Lie] "Yeah."
"Wait, are you going to puke?"
[Lie] "Yeah."

"Well, don't aim it this way!" Xoti takes an exaggerated step back, eyes wide as she waits for you to bend double. 

When nothing happens, she relaxes.
"Not even a little."

"You sure? 'Cause you look a little green in the face."

She crosses her arms over her chest, watching you with concern. After a moment passes without any retching, she relaxes her stance.
"I may not know what Gaun's got planned for me. But clearly he wanted me to meet you."
"Eothas turned tail as soon as he saw me! Not so tough now, is he?!"
"How I've missed your... colorful retellings." He grins with sly mischief.
"Pretty sure I've dreamed about my god squashing you like a bug, Watcher." She snorts.
"Maybe he was embarrassed to meet someone with a head even bigger than his."
"Thousands of suffering souls were trapped within Eothas. I was powerless to help them."
"But... surely Eothas wouldn't cause such harm on purpose. Would he?" He blinks at you and swallows.
"I don't believe the god of rebirth wishes souls to suffer. If he's harvesting them, he's got a plan."

"Yeah."

Edér punctuates the brief statement with a troubled sigh. He turns away and rubs his beard in thought.
"After seeing the agony that follows in Eothas' wake, I'm more determined than ever to stop him."
"Typical. Just when I'm on the verge of getting some answers from a god, he cuts me off."
"They've got to employ their priests somehow." He grins with sly mischief.
"Have you tried listening more and blathering less? That's what my ma used to say to me." She bites at her bottom lip to hide her brash grin.
"At least you got some. That's more than most folks."
"Guess this is why I'm captain. He's moving toward luminous adra."
"He's after luminous adra. And we're gonna stop him before he gets there."
"I saw more luminous adra in his path. But he told me not to follow, that 'something beautiful is coming.'"
"Wonder if he said the same thing to people in Readceras twenty years ago."
"Then it's a good thing I'm not in the habit of following orders anymore." He casts a rueful glance at the pillar.
"Did you tell him I was with you? I think that'd change his mind."

"You - well, he - really?! I knew it! I mean, that's great, Watcher. Ain't it?"

Xoti can barely contain herself, jumping up and down as she stumbles over her words.
"Already? Moving things along rather quickly this time, aren't we?" His eyebrows rise with sly mischief.
"Not sure if that's good or bad, but he didn't kill you, so I guess we can call it good."
"I don't believe the god of rebirth wishes souls to suffer. If he's harvesting them, he's got a plan."
"But... surely Eothas wouldn't cause such harm on purpose. Would he?" He blinks at you and swallows.

"Yeah."

Edér punctuates the brief statement with a troubled sigh. He turns away and rubs his beard in thought.
